message: can i convert arabic numbers stored in sql server varchar field as ???????????? to real values ?

data.message: If you can write a query that returns them as proper numbers, then you can parse in with some Arabic culture (as in .NET Globalization words) into a suitable .NET number type..

+1 to correcting data
Random, but useful-looking google results on it:
- http://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/21186/efficient-way-of-changing-varchar-to-nvarchar-fields-in-a-large-table-in-sql-ser
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1232449/is-it-safe-to-convert-varchar-and-char-into-nvarchar-and-nchar-in-sql-server
thanks i gonna check this solutions and tell you the result :)
i changed the collations and the old data still in ???????????? format
is that possible to convert the old data to arabic numbers ?
You should use nvarchar and not varchar
Unfortunately the data won't be restored however you can have a way to map ??? To actual data after having the people adding themselves again to your database but of course it have a high error rate
Try another version of SQL Server and make sure that your regional settings in the windows version contains Arabic and in the setup also double check for Arabic collation.
